title: Cardiac Pharmacology
visualDiagramDescription: Diagram showing beta blockers binding to cardiac cells
readingNotes: Beta blockers reduce heart rate by blocking sympathetic activity. Key drugs: metoprolol, propranolol.
kinestheticActivity: Drag each drug to its mechanism: [Beta blockers] -> [Decrease cAMP]

quizQuestions.question: Which drug class reduces heart rate by blocking beta-1 receptors?
quizQuestions.explanation: Beta blockers competitively inhibit catecholamine effects on beta-1 receptors in the heart.

quizQuestions.question: Where does most tubular reabsorption occur?
quizQuestions.explanation: The proximal tubule reabsorbs 65% of filtrate, including all glucose and amino acids.

title: Gram-Positive Bacteria
kinestheticActivity: Drag each bacterium to its disease: [S. aureus] -> [Abscess]
readingNotes: S. aureus: catalase+, coagulase+, causes TSS. Streptococcus: catalase-, beta-hemolytic.

quizQuestions.question: Which bacterium is catalase-positive?
quizQuestions.explanation: Staphylococci are catalase-positive; streptococci and enterococci are catalase-negative.
